Package lab4

Class Player

java.lang.Object
lab4.Player
class Player extends Object
This class represent each player required to play in this team. A player has a number, a name, and a role. A role can be either defense, central, striker, or goal keeper. these roles can be represented by the characters 'd', 'c', 's', or 'g'

  • Field Summary

    private char

  • Constructor Details

    • Player

      private Player(int num, String name, char role)
      This is the overloaded constructor for this class Constructs a new Player instance with the specified attributes.
      Parameters:
      num - The jersey number of the player.
      name - The name of the player.
      role - The role of the player (use 'D' for defense, 'C' for center, 'S' for striker, 'G' for goalkeeper).

    • Player

      private Player(Player player)
      This is the copy constructor for this class Constructs a new Player instance by copying the attributes from an existing Player object.
      Parameters:
      player - The Player object from which to copy attributes.

  • Method Details

    • getInstance

      public static Player getInstance()
      This is a static factory method.
      Returns:
      It returns an object of Player

    • getInstance

      public static Player getInstance(int num, String name, char role)
      This is a static factory method
      Parameters:
      num - is the player number
      name - is the name of player
      role - is the role of the player in the team
      Returns:
      It returns an object of player, which is built using the three input variables.

    • getInstance

      public static Player getInstance(Player player)
      This is a static factory method
      Parameters:
      player - is an object of Player
      Returns:
      it returns an object of Player that is built using the input parameter.
